_header: Princes proud that beth in press

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
PRinces proude þat beþ in presI wol ou telle þing
                    not lees…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Euermore to ben a boueÞer Is Ioye cumfort and loue.
                    AMEN.
BodEngPoeta1.Attributed Title: Her is of kyng Robert of Cicyle (see 1983)
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

         New York: Prentice-Hall, 1930: 933.

CULFf238.First Lines:
Pryncis þat be prowde in preseI wyll þat þat ys no
                    leesYn Tysyll was a nobull kyngeffayre & stronge & some dele
                    ȝynge…
CULFf238.Last Lines:
…That he graunt vs þat ylk blysseThat he haþ
                    ordeyned for all hys
CULFf238.Facsimiles:
McSparran,  Frances,  and  Pamela R. Robinson.  
             “Introduction.” 
             Cambridge University Library MS Ff.2.38.
         London: Scolar Press, 1979.

Hazlitt,  William Carew. 
             Remains of the Early Popular Poetry of England.

CULIi49.First Lines:
PRyncis prowde that ben in presI xal you telle þat is no
                    les…
CULIi49.Last Lines:
…Comfort vs whan we hens wendeIn to þat blysse þat
                    hath non ende
CULIi49.Attributed Title: Here endyth Kynge Roberd of Cysyle (f. 93v)
CULIi49.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl. 
             “Nachträge zu den Legenden.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         62 (1879): 397-442: 417-31.

CamGon174.First Lines:
Pryncys provde that be in preesI schall you tell that is no
                    leesse…
CamGon174.Last Lines:
…Euermore to be a boveffor there is euyr Ioy peas &
                    loue
CamGon174.Attributed Title:
Jhesu mercy (pp. 456-7, as RT), ‘lady helpe’ (pp. 458-9, as
                    RT); Explicit kyng Roberd of Cesyll (p. 468)
CamGon174.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl. 
             “Nachträge zu den Legenden.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         62 (1879): 397-442: 417-31.

BLAdd22283.First Lines: Princes proude þat beoþ in presI wol ou telle þing not les…
BLAdd22283.Last Lines: …Euermore to ben aboueÞer þat is Ioye cumfort and loue

Digital Facsimile of British Library MS Add. 22283 (‘Simeon’).

BLAdd34801.First Lines:
…When he come in
                    þat þe blod borst out of mouþ and chyn…
BLAdd34801.Last Lines:
…I schal him cloþe as þi broþer
                    Of s[...] þing and non oþer
BLAdd34801.Editions:
Hornstein,  Lillian Herlands. 
             “King Robert of Sicily: A New Manuscript.” 
             PMLA
         78 (1963): 453-8: 455.

BLHar525.First Lines: PRincis proude þat bene in preesseA thing I wull yow tell þat is no lees…
BLHar525.Last Lines: …And þat we mow have þat blysThat cryst bought for all his
BLHar525.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Harley MS 525.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?index=0&ref=Harley_MS_525.

BLHar1701.First Lines:
PRynces proude þat beþ yn presI wyl ȝow telle of
                    þyng no les…
BLHar1701.Last Lines:
…God graunte þat hyt so beAmen Amen per
                    charyte
BLHar1701.Editions:
Utterson,  Edward Vernon,
                        ed.  
             Kyng Roberd of Cysylle.
         London: Whittingham, 1839.
